statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Coastal Carolina 61, Presbyterian 41
article.story: CLINTON, S.C. -- Desmond Holloway had his fourth double-double of the season with 23 points and 14 rebounds to lead Coastal Carolina over Presbyterian 61-41 on Thursday night. Holloway had a career-high five 3-pointers in the Chanticleers' 21st straight win. Chad Gray added 20 points, seven rebounds and two blocks, and Sam McLaurin chipped in 10 points for Coastal Carolina (23-2, 14-0 Big South Conference). The Chanticleers outrebounded Presbyterian 41-26 and held a 24-6 advantage in points in the paint. Coastal Carolina led 35-15 at halftime, and the Blue Hose (10-16, 4-10) opened the second half on a 15-2 run to make it 37-30 with 14:42 left in the game. The Chanticleers answered with a 13-4 run, pushing their lead to 50-34 on Anthony Raffa's layup with 10:12 to go. Walt Allen led Presbyterian with 15 points, going 5 for 8 from 3-point range.
